      • int2ByteArray

        public static byte[] int2ByteArray​(int i)
                            throws UtilByteException
        Convert an int to a byte array.
        Parameters:
        i - integer to convert
        Returns:
        byte array, representing this integer
        Throws:
        UtilByteException - if a negative integer is put in

      • byteArray2int

        public static int byteArray2int​(byte[] byteArray)
        Convert a byte array to an int. Note: assumes byte array big-endian!
        Parameters:
        byteArray - to convert
        Returns:
        int, represented by this byteArray

      • bytesToHex

        Convert bytes to their hexadecimal representation.
        Parameters:
        bytes - to convert
        Returns:
        String with hexadecimal representation of the bytes

      • subArray

        public static byte[] subArray​(byte[] array,
                              int start,
                              int last)
                       throws UtilByteException
        Take a part of a byte array. Note: last is inclusive, so this index will be copied (different from copyOfRange: exclusive)
        Parameters:
        array - to take this part from
        start - first index to include
        last - final index to include
        Returns:
        subarray, containing the elements from the array with indices start trough last
        Throws:
        UtilByteException

      • serialiseObjectToByteArray

        public static byte[] serialiseObjectToByteArray​(java.lang.Object object)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Serialise an object to a byte array.
        Parameters:
        object - to serialize
        Returns:
        byte array, representing the object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

                                                             java.io.IOException

        Parameters:
        byteArray - containing the file array object
        Returns:
        file array
